data.title: Excellent Korean Barbeque
data.text: Very good Place to go with friends and family, economical, great value. Good Service and the meat quality was excellent. Would recommend !!!

data.title: Good Food, Lively Atmosphere
data.text: For several years every time I visit Ann Arbor I go to this restaurant. It has some of the best food in town and is always busy, so get their early or at an off time (if there is such a thing) if you want to sit quickly. Otherwise expect to wait 15-30 minutes.

data.title: Tasty dishes... the worst service ever!
data.text:
This was our first time visiting a Korean BBQ place.  We went with the combo and chose Spicy Pork, Marinated Chicken and brisket, and we ordered sweet potato noodles as an appetizer.  We understood that the combo would come with salad and rice, but it may be that we did not understand what the waitress said, because we never got rice.  We got the salad which was delicious and enough for the 4 people in our party.  The appetizers were tiny, but we got to sample different things so that was fine.  The spicy pork was really good.  The chicken was good.  The brisket was rather blunt.  The sweet potato noodles were very good.  The combo cost $45 and the appetizer about $12 if I remember correctly.

The service... now, that was unacceptable.  One of the people in our party asked for a fork.  The waitress did not bother to bring it.  We run out of water; the waitress never bothered to come and refill the pitcher.  And in fact, she sat down with other waiters, at a table across from us and started eating!  Are waiters allowed to sit down and eat while they are waiting on tables?  And if it was time for a shift change, shouldn't she have told us and have someone else wait on us for the rest of our meal?  When we got the check, there were 3 items on there, when we only ordered 2.  So i asked the new waitress who came to bring take the check (while our first waitress was eating and conversing with her fellow waiters), and she said it was for dumplings.  Looking at our dishes, she realized that we did not get dumplings, so she went to remove the charge from our card.

I will definitely go to a Korean BBQ place again; but probably not here.

data.title: sooooo much food!
data.text:
We ate on the noodle bar side of the restaurant for a recent Saturday lunch, while charging our car at the nearby library lot. It was not a game day, but the restaurant was crowded so the two of us ended up eating at the bar rather than waiting for a table. 

Service was speedy. Portions are HUGE, and when I say huge, I think my bowl could have served 3 people (not just 2). Unfortunately, we were not going to have access to a refrigerator so could not take home the leftovers. 

We started with the chicken summer rolls as an appetizer. They were tasty and quite generously sized. I had the "butter corn ramen" bowl. The description says "crispy chicken" but the crispiness is soon lost by soaking in the broth. In my opinion the chicken would be improved by cooking it without the breading, as that felt kind of greasy and heavy once broth-logged. The broth was rather too salty, so the corn added a nice sweet counterpoint that cut through the saltiness a bit. And as mentioned above, the portion was huge - too huge for comfort. I imagine a lot of food gets wasted in this establishment. My husband had the curry udon, and the broth was much thicker than anticipated but he enjoyed the flavors.

data.title: Visited ou son /student at U of M.
data.text: There for lunch.Enjoyed the food,but a little to much work to cook it......Really worried about the waiter cooking the food using the same tong for raw food and cooked food at the same time,touching raw meat the vegetables,then raw meat again and puting it in our plates....We didn't like this at all,we asked for another tong to use... Maybe will go again to try the "noddle bowls".Plus,the waiter cooked the first portion of the meat and veggies then left and never came back,we literally had to finish cooking the food.A little pricey too.

data.title: Heaven
data.text:
We stop here at the noodle bar side whenever we come to Michigan.  I have not found better noodles outside of Japan. The portions are HUGE and when they say spicy, they mean it. If you are a fan of fresh japanese, you should try this place. 
It is pretty small so there may be a wait. It is right on the Michigan campus, so be prepared to park and walk.

data.title: Where You Are Both the Chef and the Customer
data.text: If you are fancying Korean barbecue, Tomukun has a variety of stir fries, soups, meats, hotpots, assorted sides, and, best yet, tables. If you desire to eat any of the barbecue dishes, you can opt to sit at a table with its own grill. Granted, I did not use the grill, nor did anyone else in my party, but I thought the novel idea had substance. Service was very patient with us, and optimal cost could round to less than $5 per serving; if the party is large enough, that could round to near $2 per serving. Highly recommended for anyone curious.

data.title: Dinner at Tomukun
data.text: I preferred to sit indoor than outdoor. The service was good, the menu was a little misleading. I ordered broil fish and got pan fried instead. They blamed the misprinted on the menu.

data.title: Not a good introduction to Korean cuisine
data.text:
I really like Chinese food so we were looking forward to Korean food for a change. Waitress sat us outside and then told us only some items on the menu were available, though my wife liked her hot stew / soup (too spicy for me), the fried pork I had was very greasy, and lacking in flavor. We didn't try the barbeque, and we think in hindsight that is what people go for. However, at this price point - its not cheap, you could have a real banquet at a Chinese restaurant, but to top if off, later that night I genuinely felt quite queasy and sick from all the grease on the pork.

I really don't see the attraction of this cuisine. V. disappointed.

data.title: Great food, fun, casual atmosphere
data.text:
Very fresh, delicious food.  We always eat here multiple times when in Ann Arbor.  You will usually have to give your name and wait for a table but it is definitely worth the wait.   Has a fun, casual, student vibe.   It's right near the University.

The wait staff is very friendly.  The waitress filled our teacup often.  She said if she doesn't see steam coming out of the cup, she will come to refresh it.  Now that is service!

data.title: Yum!
data.text: Consistently delicious, fast service, good happy hour specials. We know that when we come here we won't be disappointed!

data.title: Tasty and Cheap
data.text:
I went there twice in one week.
I had the Ramen which was a large and very tasty dish.
The service was quick and kind, and the atmosphere was very nice.
Would definitely come back.

data.title: Cool place.
data.text: The food was great.  Had bulgogi and it was cool that it was cooked right in front of us.  Also, Kimchi Pancake appetizer was very tasty.

data.title: Get there now!
data.text: I've had Korean barbecue in California before and this place was way better! The meat was so tender and flavorful. Highly recommend the short ribs

data.title: Noodles, noodles, noodles, or rice
data.text: Great bargain and every option tasty, but takes some effort and repeated patronage to remember the distinction between dishes. Bibimbap is always a winner, with fresh veggies and a fried egg on rice, but I usually satisfy a craving for noodles with ramen, pho, or udon. Basic pho is best. Miso broth can be substituted for meat broth, and tofu is an option to make all dishes vegan. Skilled, pleasant waitstaff.

data.title: awesome asian food!
data.text: me & my wife ate lunch here and the portions where generous and the atmosphere was awesome! very good tasting food & awesome service! highly recommend!

data.title: Tomukuns review
data.text: Good food, generous portions, good price especially for Ann Arbor. Friendly service. On main strip. We visited for lunch. Clean.

data.title: Fantastic Be Bim Bop and Ramen!
data.text: We stumbled on this place during an overnight stay in Ann Arbor. We ate in the Noodle Bar, not the BBQ side. Absolutely fantastic food. My wife and I both had the Be Bim Bop and it was great, reminded me of the old Steve's Lunch from my A2 school days. My boys both had Ramen, huge bowls of homemade noodles and broth that came prepared in a variety of ways. Everything was excellent. This is my new go to lunch place in Ann Arbor.

data.title: Excellent Korean BBQ at a reasonable price
data.text: We are long time fans of Korean BBQ. Some have been truly excellent and some a disappointment. Tomukun is in the former category. It was just great! Food was fresh and the restaurant extremely clean. The cooking dome was replaced between cooking sessions. To our surprise the server managed the cooking. That's a rarity in Korean BBQ restaurants where much of the meal is DIY. Would highly recommend for the quality of the food, the service, and the atmosphere.

data.title: LOVE!!
data.text: This is our second trip to Tomukun Noodle House and it won't be the last!!! Massive piping hot bowls of delicious soup big enough for two! Paired with a bottle of ice cold SoJu you've got a fantastic meal for two for about $25!! Try the KimChi Ramen!!  Next time we'll try the Pho!! 👍🏻👍🏻
